dublinCore.dc:title: 114 HR 2643 RH: State Licensing Efficiency Act of 2015
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Williams (for himself, Mr. Fincher, Ms. Moore, Mr. Capuano, Mr. Neugebauer, Mr. Ellison, Mr. Huizenga of Michigan, Mr. Lucas, and Mr. Meeks) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services, and in addition to the Committee on the Judiciary, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

Additional sponsors: Mr. Russell, Mr. Cramer, Mr. Barr, Mr. Mullin, Mr. Al Green of Texas, Mr. Luetkemeyer, Mr. Fleischmann, Mr. Schweikert, Mr. Smith of Texas, Mr. Olson, Mr. Sessions, Mr. Cole, Mr. Pearce, Mr. Rothfus, Mr. Mulvaney, Mr. Tipton, Mr. McHenry, Mr. Vargas, Mr. Hinojosa, Mr. Poliquin, Mr. Jones, Mr. Marchant, Mr. Curbelo of Florida, Mr. Stivers, Mr. Kilmer, Mr. Simpson, Mr. Abraham, Mr. Cárdenas, Mrs. Wagner, Mr. King of New York, Mr. Delaney, Mrs. Roby, Mr. Aderholt, and Mr. Kildee
Reported from the Committee on Financial Services
The Committee on the Judiciary discharged; committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union and ordered to be printed

form.official-title: To direct the Attorney General to provide State officials with access to criminal history information with respect to certain financial service providers required to undergo State criminal background checks, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the State Licensing Efficiency Act of 2015.
Section 1511(a) of the S.A.F.E. Mortgage Licensing Act of 2008 (12 U.S.C. 5110(a)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by inserting after State-licensed loan originators the following: and other financial service providers; and
by inserting before the period the following: or other financial service providers.

endorsement.action-desc: Reported from the Committee on Financial Services
The Committee on the Judiciary discharged; committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union and ordered to be printed
